intro: Kibara versteeghii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming compact rosettes of leaves. Its flowers, which come in a variety of colors, are pollinated primarily by bees and other small insects. Kibara versteeghii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
